title: Automated ticket triage for HaloPSA with Gemini AI summary generation
description:
What it is

This workflow listens for new tickets in HaloPSA via webhook, generates a professional AI-powered summary of the issue using Gemini (or another LLM), and posts it back into the ticket as a private note.

It‚Äôs designed for MSPs using HaloPSA who want to reduce triage time and give engineers a clear head start on each support case.

‚∏ª

‚ú® Features
	‚Ä¢	üîî Webhook trigger from HaloPSA on new ticket creation
	‚Ä¢	üöß Optional team filter (skip Sales or other queues)
	‚Ä¢	üì¶ Extracts ticket subject, details, and ID
	‚Ä¢	üß† Builds a structured AI prompt with MSP context (NinjaOne, M365, CIPP)
	‚Ä¢	ü§ñ Processes via Gemini or other LLM
	‚Ä¢	üìë Cleans & parses JSON output (summary, next step, troubleshooting)
	‚Ä¢	üß± Generates a branded HTML private note (logo + styled sections)
	‚Ä¢	üåê Posts the note back into HaloPSA via API

‚∏ª

üîß Setup
	1.	Webhook
	‚Ä¢	Replace WEBHOOK_PATH and paste the generated Production URL into your HaloPSA webhook.
	2.	Guard filter (optional)
	‚Ä¢	Change teamName or teamId to skip tickets from specific queues.
	3.	Branding
	‚Ä¢	Replace YOUR_LOGO_URL and Your MSP Brand in the HTML note builder.
	4.	HaloPSA API
	‚Ä¢	In the HTTP node, replace YOUR_HALO_DOMAIN and add your Halo API token (Bearer auth).
	5.	LLM credentials
	‚Ä¢	Set your API key in the Gemini / OpenAI node credentials section.
	6.	(Optional) Adjust the AI prompt with your own tools or processes.

‚∏ª

‚úÖ Requirements
	‚Ä¢	HaloPSA account with API enabled
	‚Ä¢	Gemini / OpenAI (or other LLM) API key
	‚Ä¢	SMTP (optional) if you want to extend with notifications

‚∏ª

‚ö° Workflow overview

``üîî Webhook ‚Üí üöß Guard ‚Üí üì¶ Extract Ticket ‚Üí üß† Build AI Prompt ‚Üí ü§ñ AI Agent (Gemini) ‚Üí üìë Parse JSON ‚Üí üß± Build HTML Note ‚Üí üåê Post to HaloPSA``
disclaimer: This workflow is provided as-is. Please review and test before using in production.
